title: Job Openings at Diya, Fatimilehin & Co
content:
Diya, Fatimilehin & Co. is a leading real estate service provider with 39 years of experience providing property agency, brokerage, management & more.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Letting Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking experienced Letting Officers to connect homeowners with home seekers, minimize property void periods, and deliver high-quality client service.


Duties & Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Market residential and commercial properties.
	Manage rental enquiries and maintain records.
	Conduct property viewings.
	Handle lease negotiations.
	Conduct pre-tenancy assessments.
	Ensure all leasing documentation is completed.
	Perform other assigned duties.


Qualifications / Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Estate Management, or a related field.
	2 - 5 years of experience in property letting or related roles.


Skills & Competencies:


	Professionalism and discretion (ability to engage HNIs).
	Strong networking and negotiation skills.
	Goal-driven and able to work independently.
	Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office.


Application Closing Date: 22nd December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@diyafatimilehin.net using “Letting Officer” as the subject of the email.
Or
Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Diya, Fatimilehin & Co. is seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Accountant to join our Head Office team.
	The ideal candidate will provide comprehensive financial management support while ensuring smooth day-to-day office operations.
	This role requires accuracy, strong analytical skills, and the ability to maintain effective financial controls.


Duties & ResponsibilitiesAccounting Functions


	Maintain accurate financial records, including invoices, receipts, and payment vouchers.
	Process payments and manage petty cash transactions.
	Reconcile bank statements and monitor cash flow.
	Assist with budget preparation, financial reporting, and auditing activities.
	Ensure compliance with financial regulations and internal policies.
	Liaise with vendors as needed.


Required Qualifications / Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of relevant experience in accounting.


Skills & Competencies:


	Excellent organizational, time management, and multitasking abilities.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills (proficiency in English required).
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and CRM tools.
	Strong knowledge and experience withTally accounting software.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, confidentiality, and attention to detail.


Application Closing Date: 20th December, 2025.

How to Apply
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: careers@diyafatimilehin.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
or
Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Management Surveyor

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary / Description


	Diya, Fatimilehin & Co. is seeking experienced Management Surveyors who will manage a portfolio of properties and deliver first-class service to landlords and tenants.
	The ideal candidates must be able to work well under pressure, multitask, and adhere strictly to operational and excellence standards.
	This is an excellent opportunity for surveyors looking for a challenging opportunity in property management in a leading real estate firm. 


Key Responsibilities


	Manage a portfolio of properties
	Conduct periodic property inspections, inventories, and tenancy check-ins/outs
	Liaise with landlords and contractors to handle maintenance requests
	Manage rent reviews, arrears, and tenancy renewals
	Ensure compliance with all the procedures
	Advise landlords on property condition and tenancy issues, and maintain transparent communication
	Implement approved procedures to ensure orderly, efficient workflow
	Coordinate portfolio activities, prepare periodic and annual reports on the financial and operational performance of managed properties
	Build and maintain strong working relationships with landlords, tenants, and contractors
	Gather market intelligence for overall strategic operations
	Confirm all documentations are completed and appropriately logged
	Manage residents courteously and maintain the Firm’s client service standards
	Liaise with government agencies to ensure compliance with estate laws, payment of dues, and regulatory obligations
	Professionally represent the company at all times
	Perform other duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications / Experience


	MSc in Estate Management, Certification or registration with relevant professional/regulatory bodies is an advantage.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in property/facility management.


Application Closing Date: 27th December, 2025.

How to Apply
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: careers@diyafatimilehin.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
or
Click here to apply online

Quality Control Officer Job at Givanas Cosmetics Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Givanas Cosmetics Nigeria Limited, a manufacturing company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To manage quality assurance for our brands under while bringing a high level of efficiency and maintaining maximum effectiveness.
	The Quality Control Officer is responsible for checking and verifying the quality of all goods received, stored, and dispatched from the warehouse.
	The role ensures that products meet the company's standards before they are moved into inventory or delivered to customers.


Responsibilities


	Inspect all incoming goods to ensure they meet quality and quantity specifications.
	Check packaging, labels, expiry dates, and product conditions.
	Report damaged, missing, or incorrect items to the warehouse supervisor.
	Ensure proper storage of products according to company guidelines.
	Conduct routine quality checks on items in the warehouse.
	Verify that outgoing orders are accurate and meet quality standards before dispatch.
	Maintain quality control records and update inspection logs.
	Work with warehouse staff to correct quality issues quickly.
	Ensure compliance with safety and warehouse procedures.


Requirements


	Experience: 2 to 4 years of experience is in cosmetics/household production or manufacturing environment.
	Strong attention to detail.
	Basic understanding of warehouse operations.
	Good communication and reporting skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Prior warehouse or quality control experience is an advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:  hrm@givanascosmetics.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
